cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest Tuesday and then northeast Wednesday night, paralleling the Florida coast and passing just offshore of the Georgia-South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest approach along the Georgia–South Carolina coast (no direct landfall currently forecast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (69%) of sustained tropical-storm–force winds with a 29% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core passes close to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 4–7 ft above ground level if peak surge coincides with high tide along the Georgia coast, including areas near Brunswick.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall with isolated 10 inch totals possible, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible ahead of the cyclone’s center.
